repast.simphony.demos.sugarscape2.space

Class SugarSpace_ch2

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<T>
      • repast.simphony.context.AbstractContext<T>
        • repast.simphony.context.SmallDefaultContext<T>
          • repast.simphony.context.DefaultContext<java.lang.Object>
            • repast.simphony.demos.sugarscape2.space.SugarSpace_ch2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object>, java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object>, repast.simphony.context.Context<java.lang.Object>, repast.simphony.context.ContextListener, repast.simphony.context.RepastElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SugarSpace_ch3

    public class SugarSpace_ch2
extends repast.simphony.context.DefaultContext<java.lang.Object>

    The space in which the SugarAgents act. This is the implementation for chapter 2.

    Sugarspace contains Resources
    In the implementation of chapters 2 and 3, Sugarscape contains sugar and in chapter 4 it contains spice too. Thus we have introduced the more general notion of a "resource". We are providing methods so that SugarAgent_ch2s can interact with the resources of the Sugarspace. The details of the implementation are encapsulated in the class. Currently, we have the inner protected class SugarSpace_ch2.SpaceResource.

    Sugarspace is a Grid
    Sugarspace is a torus grid. Each grid cell contains resources and can host up to one SugarAgent_ch2. We are providing several methods with the grid* prefix that allow the interaction with the grid. We are encapsulating the implementation details in a Grid object from the Repast API.

    Sugarspace has behavior
    As described in the book, sugarspace has its own behavior TODO[describe the three behaviors]. Annotations ...

    Instantiation through the Singleton pattern
    Only one object of this class is expected to be instantiated during the simulation. For this, we use a variant of the Singleton design pattern.
    The constructor of the class is private and thus objects cannot be instantiated normally. In order to create an object you have to call the static method createInstance. In order to access the single object of this class you have to call the static method getInstance(). More details on the implementation of the Singleton pattern can be found on the comments of those methods

    Responsibilities:
    The SugarSpace object is responsible for:

    • Add or remove SugarAgent_ch2 from the space. This class extends DefaultContext (class of Repast Simphony) and thus can deal with this through the relevant inherited methods.
    • Handle the resources of Sugarscape. The relevant methods start with the resource* prefix. The first parameter is a String, denoting the name of the resource the method call is about.
    • Keep and apply the rules of the SugarSpace. In chapter 2, there are three rules:
      • Growback: This scheduled with Repast ScheduledMethod annotation on applyGrowback method
      • Replacement of agents: This is programmed in the private constructor through the Listener pattern inherited from DefaultContext
      • Diffusion of pollution: This scheduled with Repast ScheduledMethod annotation on applyDiffuse_pollution method

    Version:
    %I%
    Author:
    Dimitris Kremmydas

    • Constructor Detail

      • SugarSpace_ch2

        public SugarSpace_ch2(java.lang.String pgm_file,
                      GrowbackAbility growbackRule,
                      ReplacementAbility replacementRule,
                      PollutionDiffusionAbility diffusionRule)

        This conventional constructor is private, so that the Singleton pattern is enforced. Creation of objects is allowed only by using the createInstance method.

        TODO: addContextLitener. The replacement behavior of the Sugarspace is injected here. We are using the Observer pattern of the parent DefaultContext class. We are adding a simple object of the ContextListener interface, that it is notified every time an event has occurred and in case this event is related to an agent removal, it triggers the ReplacementAbility rule.

        Parameters:
        pgm_file - The full path to the PGM file that gives the sugar capacity allocation in space.
        growbackRule - The rule to increase the available sugar at each grid cell every clock tick. It must follow the GrowbackAbility interface.
        replacementRule - The rule to replace agent when they die. It must follow the ReplacementAbility interface.
        diffusionRule - The rule to diffuse pollution. It must follow the PollutionDiffusionAbility interface.

    • Method Detail

      • diagnostics

        public void diagnostics()

      • applyGrowback

        public void applyGrowback()
        The growback rule. Every second tick, the sugar resource in each grid cell is updated.

      • applyDiffuse_pollution

        public void applyDiffuse_pollution()
        The pollution diffusion behavior. Each 4th tick, the pollution of each grid cell is updated.

      • resourceGetCapacity

        public repast.simphony.valueLayer.GridValueLayer resourceGetCapacity(java.lang.String resource)

        Get the capacity of the resource throughout the Sugarspace. It returns a GridValueLayer with the resource. Any write operations (e.g. change the capacity) on the returned GridValueLayer, will not have any effect on the Sugarspace, since the returned object is a clone of the original one TODO[explain better].

        We assume that the capacity of grid cells of the Sugarspace cannot be changed during the simulation.

        Parameters:
        resource - The name of the resource to get the capacity for. E.g "sugar"
        Returns:
        A GridValueLayer with the capacity of the resource. Operations on this object do not have any effect on Sugarspace.
        Throws:
        RunTimeException - if the resource does not exist

      • resourceGetHolding

        public repast.simphony.valueLayer.GridValueLayer resourceGetHolding(java.lang.String resource)

        Get the current holding of a resource throughout the Sugarspace. It returns a GridValueLayer with the resource. Any write operations (e.g. change the capacity) on the returned GridValueLayer, will not have any effect on the Sugarspace, since the returned object is a clone of the original one TODO[explain better].

        In order to add or remove resource from the Sugarspace's holding, use one of the following methods of this class:

        • #resourceAddEverywhere
        • #resourceAddToXY
        • #resourceGatherFromXY

        Parameters:
        resource - The name of the resource to get the holding for. E.g "sugar"
        Returns:
        A GridValueLayer with the holding of the resource. Operations on the returned object do not have any effect on Sugarspace.
        Throws:
        RunTimeException - if the resource does not exist

                                  int quant)
        Add in every grid cell of the Sugarspace, the specified quantity of the resource
        Parameters:

        quant - An int with the quantity to add everywhere
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the resource name does not exist

      • resourceAddToXY

        public int resourceAddToXY(java.lang.String resource,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int quant)
        Adds a quantity of a resource in a X-Y coordinate of the space. It takes care so as, if the quantity added to the X-Y cell plus the existing quantity exceeds the capacity of the cell, only the difference [capacity]-[existing quantity] is added.
        Parameters:
        resource - A String with the name of the resource. E.g "sugar"
        x - The x-coordinate
        y - The y-coordinate
        quant - An int with the quantity to add
        Returns:
        The actual quantity added. If the quantity added to a grid cell goes over its capacity, the actual quantity added will be lower than the quantity added so that it always hold [existing quantity]+[quantity added] <= [capacity]
        Throws:
        RunTimeException - if the resource does not exist

        Parameters:

      • gridGetNeighboringPoints

        public java.lang.Iterable<repast.simphony.space.grid.GridPoint> gridGetNeighboringPoints(SugarAgent_ch2 a,
                                                                                         int radius,
                                                                                         Utility.TypeOfVision typeOfVision)
        Gets the neighboring GridPoints of a SugarAgent_ch2 up to a certain radius. The definition of 'neighboring point' (MOORE or von-NEUMAN) must be provided.
        Parameters:
        a - The SugarAgent_ch2 object
        radius - An int with the radius up to which to looks for neighboring GridPoints
        typeOfVision - A Utility.TypeOfVision that defines whether adjacent points are MOORE or vonNEUMAN
        Returns:
        An Iterable with all neighboring GridPoints

      • gridGetNeighboringPoints

        public java.lang.Iterable<repast.simphony.space.grid.GridPoint> gridGetNeighboringPoints(repast.simphony.space.grid.GridPoint gp,
                                                                                         int radius,
                                                                                         Utility.TypeOfVision typeOfVision)
        Gets the neighboring GridPoints of another GridPoint up to a certain radius. The definition of 'neighboring point' (MOORE or von-NEUMAN) must be provided.
        Parameters:
        gp - The GridPoint for which to calculate the neighboring GridPoints
        radius - An int with the radius up to which to find the neighboring GridPoints
        typeOfVision - A Utility.TypeOfVision that defines whether adjacent points are MOORE or vonNEUMAN
        Returns:
        An Iterable with all neighboring GridPoints

      • gridGetSugarAgentAt

        public SugarAgent_ch2 gridGetSugarAgentAt(int x,
                                          int y)
        Gets the SugarAgent_ch2 that is located in a certain GridPoint at space. If no agent is present it returns a null
        Parameters:
        x - int of the x-coordinate of the requested GridPoint
        y - int of the y-coordinate of the requested GridPoint
        Returns:
        the SugarAgent_ch2 that is located in the requested location. Null if no agent is present there.

      • gridGetDistance

        public double gridGetDistance(repast.simphony.space.grid.GridPoint point1,
                              repast.simphony.space.grid.GridPoint point2)
        Computes the euclidian distance between two points in Sugarspace. It takes into account that topology of Sugarspace is a toroid.
        Parameters:
        point1 - The first GridPoint
        point2 - The second GridPoint
        Returns:
        the euclidian distance between the points
